title: If A + B = 50, B + C = 30, and C + A = 40, what is A - B - C? - Quora

response.answer_text: Given: #1 A + B = 50, #2 B + C = 30 & #3 C + A = 40 A+B=50 (#1 given) -B-C=-30 (#2 multiplied both sides by -1) #4 A-C= 20 (add #1 & #4) #5 A+C=40 (#3 given) 2A=60 (Add #3 & #5) A = 30 (divide both sides by 2) 30 + B = 50 (replace A with the answer 30 to #1) B = 50 - 30 = 20 (subtract 20 from both sides) 30 + C = 40 (replace A with the answer 30 to #3) C = 40 - 30 = 10 (subtract 30 from both sides) 30–20–10=0 (replace all variables with answers) the result is equal to zero QED Thank you for your view. Let me answer this question… Step-1:- A+B=50 , B+c=30 And C+A=40 Step-2:- (A+B)+(B+C)+(C+A)=50+30+40 =>2(A+B+C)=120 =>A+B+C=120/2 =>A+B+C=60 Step-3:- if A+B+C=60 and A+B=50(Given), Then =>50+c=60 =>C=60–50=10 Step-4:- if A+B+C=60 and B+C=30(Given), Then =>A+30=60 =>A=60–30=30 Step-5:- if A+B+C=60 and C+A=40(Given), Then =>B+40=60 =>B=60–40=20 Step-5:- A-B-C =30–20–10 =0(Ans)
